verses.roman:
aiśvarya dekhileha 'śuddhera' nahe aiśvarya-jñāna
ataeva aiśvarya ha-ite 'kevala'-bhāva pradhāna

synonyms: aiśvarya—opulence; dekhileha—even after seeing; śuddhera—of a pure devotee; nahe—is not; aiśvarya-jñāna—knowledge of opulence; ataeva—therefore; aiśvarya ha-ite—than the understanding of opulence; kevala-bhāva—pure emotion; pradhāna—more eminent.
translation: "Even if a pure devotee sees the opulence of Kṛṣṇa, he does not accept it. Therefore pure consciousness is more exalted than consciousness of the Lord's opulence.
